messages.subject: Re: Help! I want out.
messages.msgSnippet: ... ******************************* On paper, hold her back and then skip a year - its the common trick in my neck of the woods. ... ************* What parts
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "dawnpedroza" <dawnpedroza@...> wrote:
>The other problem that comes to my mind is that we are required to test at third, fifth, eight and tenth. My eldest was tested at the end of third and is supposed to test next year. How do I get around this?
*******************************

On paper, hold her back and then skip a year - its the common trick in my neck of the woods.

>> I really like the idea of unschooling and yet it scares me to death.
*************

What parts scare you? Can we help calm your nerves?

---Meredith (Mo 7, Ray 15)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Help! I want out.
messages.msgSnippet: What are you supposed to do with test results? That would be my big question. Some states don t do anything with them, they don t even want to see them, you re
messages.messageBody:
What are you supposed to do with test results? That would be my big
question.

Some states don't do anything with them, they don't even want to see
them, you're just required to test.

Other states will want to see that the child tests in the top 50% of
age related children. If they don't, then what? Can you test again?

I would honestly look more into that before I worry.
Melissa
Mom to Joshua, Breanna, Emily, Rachel, Samuel, Daniel, Avari, and
baby Nathan!
Wife to Zane

blog me at
http://startlinglives.blogspot.com/
http://startlinglives365.blogspot.com



On Apr 15, 2009, at 11:30 PM, dawnpedroza wrote:

>
>
> I have been homeschooling my two daughters for five years now. It
> is not working for my eldest daughter. She hates everything to do
> with it. I really like the idea of unschooling and yet it scares me
> to death. The other problem that comes to my mind is that we are
> required to test at third, fifth, eight and tenth. My eldest was
> tested at the end of third and is supposed to test next year. How
> do I get around this?
>
>
>

messages.subject: Help! I want out.
messages.msgSnippet: I have been homeschooling my two daughters for five years now. It is not working for my eldest daughter.  She hates everything to do with it.  I really like
messages.messageBody: I have been homeschooling my two daughters for five years now. It is not working for my eldest daughter. She hates everything to do with it. I really like the idea of unschooling and yet it scares me to death. The other problem that comes to my mind is that we are required to test at third, fifth, eight and tenth. My eldest was tested at the end of third and is supposed to test next year. How do I get around this?
